review:
So, here's supposedly how the meeting went: "hey, we just released our first game and we put in some of the worst possible mechanics in all of video gaming stolen from the 8 bit and 16 bit eras of video games, so now what?" The reply came "let's add even more of the worst possible mechanics to put inside of a video game!" In this aspect, this game clearly surpasses its original but it is in the worst possible way. 

From the few minutes I played, I can confidently state that now we have AI enemies that read your inputs and react, even if it makes no sense, like one enemy jumped because I jumped when he was completely safe from me and any possible bullets I can fire. Furthermore, there were some annoying pixel-perfect jumps in the first game but there were like three. Three total. In the first couple of levels, this game already had like five and that's when I decided I've had enough of this game. No, I didn't beat it. I have no patience for something that's designed to be stupid to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1651108089}
review:
Where the fuck to start?

The first Gunman Clive is a fun, albeit short, sidescroller adventure shoot’em up game. It was challenging, but it was engaging and fun, above all else, it had different difficulty settings that were all in all, for the most part, well balanced.

This sequel, has more characters, more gameplay diversity, and even a richer colour pallet, but at its core, the philosophies of the game design have changed and sadly, they have changed for the worse…

The game is relentlessly difficult and around halfway through, as soon as I got to a level where you’re on rails on top of a panda running away from a buzzsaw, after dying more than 30 times, I just decided to call it quits, it wasn’t… Frustrating perse, like it wasn’t so much that it angered me, as much as that it got tiresome and annoying after a while, and as such, I just didn’t really felt like playing it any longer, eventually, it felt like a waste of time, it’s a shame too because the difficulty settings don’t do anything for that level (really makes you think why have difficulty settings at that point), it’s as if the developers deliberately wanted to artificially prolong the duration of the game by lengthening it with an absurd amount of difficulty that isn’t balanced, nor is it fair; as such, the game turns into a tedious exercise in patience.

Even the new character isn’t that good, it just seems as if an alternate difficulty mode given that he doesn’t have a ranged attack, just an spear that can get enemies at short range…

review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Платформер с приятной графикой, разнообразным геймплеем и кучей коротких, но интересных уровней. Вторая часть стала еще интереснее и насыщеннее. Сюжета по прежнему нет, но вот локаций по которым мы будем путешествовать вдоволь - нам придется путешествовать по всему земному шару. Каждая локация это новый антураж и тематика страны куда мы попадаем, например в Китае мы будем кататься на панде... Персонажи остались все старые - ковбой, девка, утка (после прохождения игры) и добавился новый герой - индеец. Уровни также постоянно удивляют чем-то новым, вот мы бежим по пустыне и тут вдруг в пещере, а потом сражаемся с роботом, уничтожаем тиранозавра, летим на птеродактиле и т.п. Очень порадовало исправление управления, а также крутые версии боссов. На последнего босса я потратил 2 часа при сложности Normal. Что уж говорить о сложностях выше и это настоящий вызов для любителей трудных достижений. Однозначно рекомендую и очень был бы рад увидеть третью часть игры когда нибудь.

[h1]Оценка: 8/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

review:
手書き感あるグラフィックが良く、絶妙な難易度で進んでいける横スクロールアクションです。
死亡しても瞬時にリトライできるのであまりストレスを感じさせない作りになっていると感じた。
前作の「Gunman Clive」と比べ、今作はジャングルや日本のような世界観もあり、3Dシューティング要素も盛り込まれている。
実績解除しようとすると結構なやりこみが必要になるのも面白いと思った。

review:
Продолжение хорошего платформера.
У разработчика этой игры есть чувство меры и этого сильного не хватает большей части индиделов.
На каждом уровне игра дает какие-то новые механики и комбинирует их друг с другом, но при этом чувствует, когда механика начинает надоедать и идёт дальше. Рекомендуется начинающим разработчикам и вообще людям, интересующимся геймдизайном.
Если с точки зрения просто поиграть - то два часа разнообразного платформинга с хорошей музыкой. Четыре персонажа и задротные ачивки на нодамаг и спидран. Сюжета нет.
Годное инди.

review:
Znaczne lepszy od jedynki.
Rozgrywka to solidny oldskulowy platformer.
Poziomy są zróżnicowane, a do tego jest sporo unikalnych i bardzo ciekawych mechanik, jak jazda na pandzie, modyfikujące grawitacje miejsca. Walki z bossami są bardzo ciekawe i przyjemne. Małym minusem poziomów jest fakt, że do przejścia wymagają zapamiętania niektórych sekwencji ponieważ nie wszystko da się ominąć za pomocą  refleksu.
Przeciwnicy są zróżnicowani i wpisują się w motyw poziomów.
Negatywnie wypadają pseudo 3D poziomy na szynach (a'la Starfox). Sterowanie w nich jest niezbyt czytelne i bardziej frustrują niż bawią.
Grafika jest bardzo kolorowa i ładna.
Muzyka wpada w ucho, zwłaszcza podczas walk z bossami.
8/10

review:
Gunman Clive 2 continues the zany nature of the original with more creative, well-designed levels and gameplay.  I highly recommend it, as well as the original, if you're a fan of Mega Man-style platformers.

The game packs a lot of variety in locations, enemies and gameplay mechanics.  Compared to the original, it's more colorful, it has an even better soundtrack, and the levels are expertly paced to throw new and clever gameplay ideas at you constantly.  Not a single screen is wasted and everything feels meticulously planned.

I really have nothing negative to say about it.  This is a textbook example of a great platformer.

review:
This is better than the first one in every single way.

The physics are more polished, the level design is even more creative (shockingly so), the enemies are more weird and challenging, the variety in the different areas is impressive, the bosses are even better, and the music is a huge improvement.

There are new gameplay styles to deal with, new uses for old mechanics, and new colors to pop out of the screen. Even if you own the 3DS version, this is worth it just for the graphical improvements from that version.

It's well-made, it's fun, it's got good music, it's got a panda, and it's three bucks. Buy it. Awesome job, Mr. Horberg!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1474967846}
review:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein Sidescroller Western Action Game im Stile von MegaMan und Co.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man spielt wieder entweder einen Cowboy Clive, eine Lady, eine Ente oder einen Indianer. Der Cowboy Clive hat eine Standard Steuerung, die Lady kann alles was Clive kann aber kann nach einem Sprung noch etwas Schweben und die Ente hat keine Waffen und kann Fliegen bzw. flattern, was der Indianer kann weis ich nicht..

Man läuft von links nach rechts und schiesst die Gegner aber auftauchen, ab und zu lassen die Gegner dann neue Waffen und Energie fallen um sich aufzubessern. Nach einer gewissen Anzahl an Leveln erwartet einen dann ein Boss um die nächsten Level freizuschalteten. Es gibt neue Level Spezialwelten wo man Reiten, fliegen  uvm. Machen muss, leider Steuern die sich am schlechtesten. Es wurden im auch teilweise neue Elemente im zweiten Teil eingebracht wie das man an gewisse Oberflächen dran gesaugt wird und man 360° umlaufen kann. Leider ist das soetwas von schlimm zu Steuern das es wirklich nervt.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grafik:

Die Grafik und das Design ist wirklich sehr passen zum Western Spiel.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Die Musik ist ganz OK, zum Anfang sehr passen aber manchmal wirkt es sehr unpassend.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Die Steuerung Ok, der Charakter steuert sich sehr schwammig was es nicht gerade einfacher macht. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ schöne Idee
+ Teilweise sehr gute Musik
+ unterschiedliche Schwierigkeitsgrade
- schwammig Steuerung
- wenig Action
- wenig Erneuerungen zum Vorgänger

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Ich war schon vom ersten Teil nicht so begeistert aber für Fans denke ich ist es schon einen Blick wert. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist ganz gut gewählt, aber auf Normal bin ich gut durchgekommen. Es hat schon sehr abwechslungsreich Level aber zum Ende wird es wirklich etwas nervig und teilweise passt es einfach gar nicht rein (wie an Wänden und Decken laufen). Es ist schon eine gute Fortsetzung die aber hätte besser sein können, leider ist es wieder wie in Teil 1 auch das hier auch immer Glück im Spiel sein muss um gut durchzukommen, den die Gegner Dropen nur selten Waffen

Es ist sicherlich für MegaMan Fans eher was als wie für mich der MegaMan nie grossartig gespielt hat. Mit Clive braucht man circa 1 Stunde also circa 3 Stunden mit allen Charakteren was ganz OK ist. Wer also auf so etwas steht wird hier sicherlich seinen Spass haben, aber für mich war es nichts.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 4/10
Grafik: 9/10
Musik: 6/10
Steuerung: 4/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 6/10

review:
Clive is back pour une aventure en mode plus plus plus. Plus de niveaux, plus de personnages jouables et plus d’ennemis.  La difficulté a été revue à la hausse et les boss ne se laissent plus faire si facilement. Deux fois plus long que son prédécesseur et également doté d’une bonne rejouabilité, Gunman Clive 2 propose un voyage fantasque entre Far West, monts enneigés et terres préhistoriques oubliées. Tous les éléments de gameplay du premier sont de retour, et certaines nouveautés bien senties font leurs apparitions (séquences en véhicule en simili-mode 7 ou à dos d’animal, gravité circulaire, etc).

Le chef indien, nouveau personnage jouable, dispose d’une seule attaque au corps-à-corps et d’un saut mieux maitrisé - deux éléments qui apportent au gameplay fraicheur et nouveauté.

Le second opus de la franchise ne révolutionne rien mais confirme avec talent les acquis du premier et se permet même d’aller plus loin. Doté d’une animation toujours au top, d’une bande-son plus étudiée et d’une longévité accrue, le titre est un hommage réussi aux productions de l’ère 8/16bits. Vivement la suite.

Le feu d’un duel au soleil.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985215786', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1527288107}
review:
Con gli indie piattaforma è sempre un terno al lotto: a volte si prendono certe fregature incredibili, altre volte si assiste a uno scopiazzamento generale, mentre poche volte arriva al miracolo. Gunman Clive 2 non è sicuramente il miracolo, così come non lo era il suo predecessore, ma per quanto abbia notato e segnato su un taccuino tutti quegli elementi che, di fatto, sono dei simpatici tributi al passato, continuo a provare un profondo affetto per i prodotti del buon Bertil Hörberg.

Anche perché il secondo capitolo del simpatico pistolero è perfettamente in linea con quanto già visto nel primo episodio (di cui vi abbiamo già parlato con piacere): destreggiandosi tra salti e scalinate, il buon Gunman Clive dovrà far fuori nemici e avversità per giungere alla fine del suo tragitto. Se però nel primo capitolo il nostro compito era salvare la bella Ms Johnson, adesso sia il nostro cowboy sia la bella figliola saranno da subito disponibili per affrontare i 23 quadri della campagna di base, con l’aggiunta di un nuovo terzo personaggio: il capo indiano.

Com’è facile immaginare, i tre personaggi avranno un sistema di gioco peculiare, dal più classico cowboy che spara da lontano, alla signorina che ricalca fedelmente la buona Princess Peach con dei salti “plananti”, fino al pellerossa armato di lancia che, invece, si darà al combattimento corpo a corpo. Una soluzione sicuramente da apprezzare rispetto al primo episodio, in cui assistiamo a una modifica tecnica dell’approccio alle singole sfide che dovremo affrontare. In fondo, come dicevo, i quadri non hanno particolari caratteristiche per i quali ci ricorderemo di Gunman Clive 2, ma l’idea di ambientare il percorso dei nostri eroi dalla west coast americana fino allo spazio ha permesso a Hörberg Productions di personalizzare le singole location con elementi molto simpatici. Fra tutti, spiccano sicuramente i livelli a cavallo di dinosauri o marchingegni vari, i quali trasformeranno questo carinissimo platform in un arcade di volo (con grande citazione di StarFox), o ancora un Tetris “in terza persona”, o più semplicemente un rimando ben più ovvio a capolavori indipendenti quali VVVVVVVV.

Probabilmente non il gioco più originale dell’anno, ma la cura e l’amore messi dallo sviluppatore rendono Gunman Clive 2 un gioiellino che difficilmente potrà deludervi. Basti pensare anche alla ricercatezza grafica del tratto a matita, ora perfino a colori. Bello da vedere e soprattutto reso in maniera davvero molto piacevole nonostante l’ovvia semplicità. Per di più, il gioco è accompagnato da una colonna sonora bellissima, a tema e sempre incalzante, tanto che non sarebbe affatto male poterla sentire anche al di fuori del contesto ludico. Insomma, rispetto al primo episodio, è indubbio come Gunman Clive 2 ne sia a tutti gli effetti un’ottima evoluzione ideologica e di sviluppo, in particolare grazie all’attenzione verso un game design semplice, ma sempre coinciso, diretto. Un plauso va anche al bellissimo lavoro compiuto per gli scontri contro i boss: sempre più grossi e sempre più cattivi, la scalata che vi porterà ad affrontare il cattivone finale è simpatica e, nonostante i pattern facili da identificare, il livello di sfida assicura un impegno via via maggiore per poter essere completato.

A chiudere tutto abbiamo, come sempre, la modalità papero, in cui controlleremo un anatroccolo disarmato che dovrà affrontare tutti i vari livelli senza colpire o farsi colpire i nemici. Un giochillo di fatto, che non si discosta affatto dalla sua semplice richiesta di soli 3 euro per essere acquistato su Steam. Non vi durerà più di un’ora, un’ora e mezza, ma se volete supportare questo simpatico e visionario sviluppatore indipendente, sappiate che il poco tempo speso su Gunman Clive 2 non sarà sicuramente deludente.
Ho cavalcato uno pterodattilo e affrontato la segreta seta dei paperi assassini grazie a un codice gentilmente offerto dagli sviluppatori.

7,5

CONSIGLIATO A
Chi non l'ha ancora giocato su 3DS, chi ha apprezzato il primo capitolo, chi cerca un gioco piattaforma semplice ma stiloso, chi vuole un giochino che dura poco, ma che sa regalare quell'oretta e mezza di divertimento old school che ogni tanto serve.

SCONSIGLIATO A
Chi cerca un gioco con grafica all'ultimo grido, chi vuole un gioco piattaforma con enigmi ambientali, terza dimensione e compagnia bella.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105646510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1517426023}
review:
[b]Gunman Clive 2[/b] is the sequel to one of my favourites from 2014. What happened? I'll get the good out of the way, so what does Gunman Clive 2 do right? To start the soundtrack is as good if not better than the original, featuring more varied tracks. The controls are fair, though this might just be me adjusting to the steam controller, but I feel the original had tighter controls. Bosses are more interesting and the difficulty has increased overall with both Chieftain Bob and the Duck offering a mix-up to the regular gameplay all of the above is what I appreciate from this game. 

So what do I feel Gunman Clive got wrong? The clear crisp sketch like visuals are now muddier than before, where previously colour was limited to enemies, various effects and the occasional bit of background scenery, now that everything is in colour I feel something has been lost in the transition. World and level design also feels off to me, devoid of originality. No longer does the stages feel concise but rather littered around the world for the sake of "more diverse environments". The stages suffer as a result, becoming both unoriginal and forgettable.

I think the worst part is one of my major complaints about the original title still stands. Difficulty levels are meaningless, yes the difficulty of the game has increased but the choice of difficulty is pretty inconsequential, especially if you're going for the no damage run. 

I'll summarise for the sake of clarity, I don't think this is an inherently bad game, but as a sequel it has left me disappointed. If you do want to get this, I would urge you buy the 3DS version if you can as it is pretty much better than any other version of the game. I didn't want to give this a negative review, it's really deserving of a mixed review. So I guess I'll be the one to leave the first public negative review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139158591', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1651835439}
review:
This is a superb little platformer. If you like Mario, Donkey Kong Country, Shovel Knight, etc. you will enjoy this. 

I played this without playing the original Gunman Clive. There isn't any story so it didn't matter at all.

It's a short game - I beat it in 3 hours (on Easy) - but you can replay it with different characters if you want to.

Some of the stages are quite tricky, but every time I died I felt it was because of my own mistakes, not bad luck or bad design. (Actually the levels are very well designed with plenty of variety to keep it interesting.) You have unlimited lives so you eventually learn how to complete each stage, and it's very satisfying when you do.

Note that when you die you go back to the beginning of the stage, which can be frustrating, but the stages are quite short so it's not such a big deal.

My only real criticism is the Steam Achievements are only awarded on finishing the game with different characters. A few mid-game achievements would have been nice.

I give Gunman Clive 2 a 9/10. Highly recommended!

review:

review:
Was ist Gunman Clive 2? Ein Spiel was meiner Meinung nach vor Donkey Kong Country und Super Mario Wold/Bros.2 auf die Knie geht und trotzdem genug eigene Ideen mitbringt. Um erstmal den Bezug zu den beiden Spielen herzustellen muss gesagt werden das sich Gunman Clive 2 einiger Gameplay und Levelideen dieser Spiele bedient (Lorenlevel aus Donkey Kong, Level welches auf 3 Schlösser von Super Mario World anspielt und ein Charakter kann schweben wie in Super Mario Bros. 2). Doch dann gibt es noch die wichtigste Eigenschaft von Gunman Clive 2, es ist ein Shooter welches zwar Jump n Run Elemente mit einbringt aber zum Hauptteil ein Shooter ist. Ihr müsst Menschen, Tiere, Maschinen und Bosse besiegen welche bei den 3 Schwierigkeitsgraden nicht ganz so einfach zu besiegen sind. Für Abwechselung sorgen zwischen den Leveln immer wieder andere Level in welchen Ihr Reiten, Fliegen oder wie oben genannt mit einer Lore fahren müsst. Diese vielen tollen unterschiedlichen Level und eine perfekte Steuerung machen Gunman Clive 2 zu einer 100% Kaufempfehlung. Daumen hoch!!!

[h1] More Worthy Than it's Predecessor[/h1]

After just a few levels, I've come to the conclusion that THIS installment of Gunman Clive is better than the first. As much as I love the first one (and still play it every now and then on my 3ds) this one is just vibrant with more beautiful colors, music, and textures. Not to mention the more challenging gameplay, which is bound to make you get tons of retries on your first playthrough. Plus, with the extra challenges like "No Damage", as well as 4 save files, and 4 playable characters (with one locked) each with their own abilities, it's bound to keep you interested in it for a long time. Plus, it's cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041866571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1558198888}
review:
TL;DR: Kaufempfehlung. Side-Scroller mit gutem Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis.

Gunman Clive 2 ist, wie auch sein Vorgänger Gunman Clive, ein an die NES / SNES Tage angelehnter Side-Scroller. Einflüsse aus Spielen wie Mega Man und Donkey Kong sind erkennbar. Der Grafik-Stil ist dagegen moderner gehalten und kommt mit einem einzigartigen Look daher.

Die Level sind recht schwer und man hat nur ein Leben pro Level. Das bedeutet, dass ihr nach jedem Tod wieder am Anfang des Levels starten müsst. Das klingt schlimmer als es ist. Die Level sind kurz genug um nicht in Frustration zu enden. Zudem gibt es 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade. Ich habe auf normaler Schwierigkeit gespielt und hatte soweit keine Frustmomente.

Die Level sind recht abwechslungsreich. Mal reitet ihr einen Bären, mal seid ihr auf Schienen in einer Miene und mal fliegt ihr auf dem Rücken eines Flugsauriers. Bosskämpfe gibt es auch.

Zur Auswahl stehen vier Charaktere von denen ihr 3 gleich zu Beginn wählen könnt.
Die Musik passt zum Spiel. Sie erfüllt ihren Zweck und sorgt für eine positive Stimmung.
Der XBox One Controller funktionierte für mich ohne Probleme.
Da Spiel ist recht kurz aber auch entsprechend günstig. Ich würde es uneingeschränkt empfehlen.
